694335.trustfund:
TF020917-STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT CREDIT,TF020281-VIETNAM - SOCIAL ADJUSTMENT
            CREDIT (2ND CONTRIBUTION),TF021373-PHRD-ECONOMIC REFORM PROGRAM,TF020802-STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT CREDIT,TF020269-VIETNAM - SOCIAL ADJUSTMENT CREDIT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Structural Adjustment
            Credit (SAC) Project for Vietnam were as follows: outcomes
            were highly satisfactory, project sustainability was likely,
            Bank performance was highly satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was also highly satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: it was successful in supporting the
            Government's effort to stabilize the economy and
            sustain a high growth rate. The SAC helped the Government to
            frame some concrete steps in the reform agenda by focusing
            on specific weaknesses that needed to be addressed as
            prerequisites for further reforms. The principal feature for
            the success of the SAC operation in Vietnam is that it
            reflected the strategy of the Government in its reform and
            adjustment program. This reform program grew out of the
            close policy dialogue between the Bank and the Government
            since the late 1980s. These features will continue to serve
            well in the future for a fruitful cooperation between the
            Bank and the Government as Vietnam embarks on a more
            complicated path to sustainable development. The
            implementation of the measures supported by the Bank's
            first SAC in Vietnam has led to a strong macroeconomic
            performance and helped further the transition to a market
            economy. Nevertheless, sustaining Vietnam's recent
            economic performance will require further reform to improve
            investment efficiency and raise domestic resource
            mobilization, as well as ensure the sustainability of the
            balance of payments. Further reform measures in these areas
            will be supported by a second structural adjustment
            operation, currently under preparation.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Viet Nam Structural Adjustment
            Credit Project will help strengthen the balance of payments
            position of Viet Nam at a time when major changes are being
            implemented which aim at further integrating the economy
            with the international system. The credit will support the
            consolidation of a suitable medium-term framework in which
            structural reform can be pursued in a growth-oriented
            manner. The credit will also support macroeconomic stability
            through improved management of the budget and state
            enterprises. It will strengthen the incentive for private
            saving and investment through banking and foreign trade
            reforms. The credit will finance general imports of goods to
            meet part of the economy's external financing requirements.
